entry.title: Chug
entry.summary:
Score: 66 (out of 100) / Rank: 48th (out of 139 beers) / A great can design and it poured with a nice head and a cloudy appearance.
A clear and almost fluffy taste with a twist of bitterness coming through.
I think this was my first XPA and hoping it won’t be the last

entry.title: Free Gelato Ice Cream Sour
entry.summary:
Score: 76 (out of 100) / Rank: 21st (out of 139 beers) / Another sour beer and this one had a lovely smell as I poured.
And the taste was fruity with a nice zingy sour which went down really smoothly. I hate to say it but I’m liking the sour beers recently.
My son tried it and said he liked it and also didn’t like it at the same time.

entry.title: Littler Bitter
entry.summary:
Score: 49 (out of 100) / Rank: 87th (out of 139 beers) / The darkest beer I have had for a while but I didn’t get anything in the smell.
Taste wise it was a little bitter but no real strong taste coming through, pleasant but nothing to write home about.

entry.title: Free Gelato Coffee Ice Cream Sour

link.title: Free Gelato Coffee Ice Cream Sour

entry.summary:
Score: 67 (out of 100) / Rank: 45th (out of 139 beers) / A another UK heatwave and what do you want on a far like that we ice cream and for today that comes in the form of a coffee ice cream sour beer.
Didn’t like the colour of this one but the smell was pleasant. I could get coffee, and mango in the taste with a kick of sour in the mix.
I haven’t had much luck with sour beers bu...

entry.title: Lucky Saint (on tap)
entry.summary:
Score: 97 (out of 100) / Rank: 1st (out of 139 beers) / Today I had a PINT and it’s only been my second since I gave up drinking alcohol in 2011! This one was actually on tap the previous was just a Heineken zero out of a blade machine on the top of a bar.
I’ve been meaning to go to the Tap in Marlbourgh since I had seen it on the AF club on tap map as it is not far from my house ...
